alert.note: Alert for La Sal and Abajo Mountains; Southeast Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 11:21AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central San Juan County through 1145 AM MDT... At 1121 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Blanding, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central San Juan County. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 51 and 70. U.S. Highway 491 in Utah between mile markers 3 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: La Sal and Abajo Mountains; Southeast Utah
